newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy machine tool orders pick up in 1997 Q2.
newsitem.headline: Italy machine tool orders pick up in 1997 Q2.

text.p: Italian machine tool orders rose 13.9 percent in the second quarter of 1997, marking a recovery from the negative trend seen over the last six quarters, the machine tool manufacturers' association UCIMU said.

UCIMU said in a statement that domestic demand rose 31.5 percent while foreign orders slipped 2.2 percent. The outlook for the whole of 1997 was seen as steady with a slight overall rise in orders of some seven percent.

Italian machine tool orders had fallen by 5.2 percent in the first quarter, mainly due to a 21.2 percent slump on domestic demand which was only partly offset by a 14.9 percent rise in foreign orders.
The slowdown in foreign orders in the second quarter was due mainly to uncertainty of demand in Italy's main markets, particularly in Germany and France.
But UCIMU said prospects looked more positive for Italian exports in the second half of this year especially in the United States and in emerging markets.
